item.title: My Experience as a Teaching Assistant in the School of Computing
item.author: Zhu Yufan
item.description: Last week, I completed my journey as a Teaching Assistant (TA) in the School of Computing. This role has been a valuable and rewarding experience, and I want to share my journey as a TA, including how I got the position and the insights I gained from this opportunity. 🎓 The Module I Taught I served as a TA for the module CS1101S Programming Methodology. 🖥️ CS1101S introduces the concepts of programming and computational problem-solving.

item.title: Unexpected Use of Zobrist Hashing :eyes:
item.author: Zhu Yufan
item.description: I’m excited to share a surprising discovery I made while working on a programming assignment for the CS3230 module, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, at NUS. This revelation involves the unexpected application of Zobrist Hashing, a technique primarily designed for board games, to efficiently solve a challenging problem unrelated to gaming. Get ready for a bit of technical insight! Revisiting Zobrist Hashing 🕹️ In my previous post, I shared my experiences developing an AI agent to play the board game “Breakthrough” for the CS2109S individual project.

item.title: The Power of Iterative Deepening Minimax Search with Alpha-Beta Pruning 💥
item.author: Zhu Yufan
item.description: In my pursuit of knowledge in Computer Science, I undertook a mini-project during the course CS2109s (Introduction to AI and ML). The project aimed to build an AI agent for a simple yet intriguing board game called Breakthrough, implementing the iterative deepening minimax search algorithm with alpha-beta pruning. The capabilities of this AI agent left me amazed and eager to share my journey with you! 🌐🔍

item.title: My Journey to NUS Computer Science and the S&T Scholarship 🕶️
item.author: Zhu Yufan
item.description: Welcome to my post, where I share my experience of getting accepted into NUS Computer Science and being awarded the prestigious S&T Merit Scholarship. This journey might be especially relevant for international students studying in Singapore. 🌍✈️

item.title: Modules that I have taken for each semester in NUS :eyes:
item.author: Zhu Yufan
item.description: This is not a very formal post, just keeping track of all the modules that I have taken across the years.
